body: Are you able to provide the mesh that is causing this panic?

not easily no because it could be one of many and it was one generated by a procgen mesh algo  :( 

this algo https://github.com/ethereumdegen/bevy_clay_tiles/blob/master/src/pre_mesh.rs
Even a `println!("{:?}", mesh)` would probably be useful.

The panic occurs in the function `bevy_mikktspace::generated::genTangSpace` due to a scenario where the number of valid triangles (`iNrTrianglesIn`) becomes zero after degenerate triangle detection and removal. This leads to the `InitTriInfo` function being called with zero triangles, causing a panic.
Ohhh lol its probably a mesh with a width of 0.0 .  So basically an invalid mesh like a plane. But still
As I understand it, `bevy_mikktspace` may not be in a place where we can really fix stuff like this until #9050 gets reviewed/merged.

issue.title: Fix underflow panic in `InitTriInfo`
